questionsJson.description: Why is the woman calling?
questionsJson.explanation:
W: Hello. 32 I'm calling about my tickets for tonight's baseball game. I'm hoping to upgrade my seats so we can sit closer to the field. The reservation is under my name: Joanna Reynolds.

M: Let me take a look. Hmm. 33 I'm sorry, Ms. Reynolds, but our system seems to be down at the moment. I can do the exchange manually, but it'll take a little longer.

W: No problem. I have time.

M: Thanks. Oh, and 34 just a reminder that better seats will cost more-you'll need to pay about 15 dollars more per seat.

questionsJson.description: What event will the speakers be attending later today?
questionsJson.explanation:
W: Thilo, 35 are you going to the company lunch later this morning at Sullivan Bistro? 36 I'm not sure how to get there.

M: Well, 36 the train stops right near it on Hanover Street, but you'd have to transfer a few times. You know, 35, 36 I'm getting a rid& with Farida, and she has a van.

W: Oh, that would be convenient! 37 Do you know where her desk is?

M: Yes. 37 She has the cubicle closest to the stairs.

questionsJson.description: Why does the man say, "she has a van"?
answer: (A) To suggest inquiring about a ride
(B) To express surprise at a coworker's choice of vehicle
(C) To explain why a coworker was late
(D) To clarify that a coworker helped him move

questionsJson.description: Where do the speakers work?
questionsJson.explanation:
M: Hi, Sarika. 38 We need a new assistant manager here at Jeera Groceries. You've been one of our best cashiers for two years now. Are you interested in the position?

W: Wow. I definitely am. 39 My one concern is the working hours. Would my schedule change significantly?

M: You might have to work overtime once in a while, like when food deliveries arrive late, but that doesn't happen often. 40 Why don't you think about it for a few days? Let me know what you decide

questionsJson.description: Why is the woman calling?
questionsJson.explanation:
M: Good morning. This is Westerly Travel's customer service. How may I help you?

W: Yes, 41 I was supposed to· take the two P.M. from Denver to Colorado Springs, but it was canceled. I need to book a different train. 42 I'm presenting at a trade show first thing in the morning, so I'm hoping you can get me on another train today.

M: The four P.M. departure gets you in by six thirty, and there are plenty of seats available.

W: That sounds great.

M: 43 And to apologize for the inconvenience, I've upgraded you to business class at no extra charge.

questionsJson.description: Where does the woman work?
questionsJson.explanation:
W: This is Marcy Ardmore at Sladen Motors. 44 Some automotive parts we ordered from your factory haven't arrived at our dealership yet.

M: I'm sorry to hear that. We sent your order over a week ago, but the shipping company has been experiencing delays. Unfortunately, 45 the tracking e-mails they sent us don't contain enough detail to determine when the parts will get to you.

W: I see. 46 Do you have contact information for the shipping company? I'd like to see what I can find out.

M: 46 Yes, I can give you their phone number. But I'll also call them. Hopefully the more inquiries they get, the more seriously they'll take the issue.

questionsJson.description: What is the conversation mainly about?
questionsJson.explanation:
M: Amina, 47 how are plans progressing for the September release of our new model of mobile phone?

W: 47 Good. 48 Right now, the marketing department is looking at advertising options and thinking about the best way to get maximum exposure in the media.

M: Great. And what's the update from our manufacturer about when they'll begin production? Last time we spoke, 49 you mentioned that the factory was at full capacity with other projects, and I'm worried that'll affect our timeline.

W: I just spoke with them, and they'll free up room for us soon.

questionsJson.description: What event are the speakers discussing?
questionsJson.explanation:
M: 53 Marcella, we have a problem with the business conference we're hosting next week. I just got a call from the conference center, and they said there's been water damage to three of the meeting rooms.

W: Oh no! 54 But the rooms will be repaired in time for our conference, right?

M: They said there's a lot of damage.

W: OK. 55 Well, the weather's supposed to be nice, so we could host some of the seminars outdoors. It's a little unconventional, but there's plenty of space surrounding the conference center.

questionsJson.description: What does the man mean when he says, "there's a lot of damage"?
answer: (A) He finally fully understands a problem.
(B) The woman should expect a bill in the mail.
(D) A schedule needs to be adjusted.

questionsJson.description: What industry do the speakers most likely work in?
questionsJson.explanation:
M: OK, 56 Marion, the new health-care software is all set up on your computer. It should be pretty straightforward to use. But call technology support if you run into any issues.

W: Great. 56 I hear a lot of health-care providers are switching to this same software.

M: Yes. 57 It's becoming popular because it retains all of a patient's medical records from different providers in one central system.

W: Excuse me. Sorry to interrupt.

M: No problem, Francesca. What's up?

W: I overheard what you said, and just to clarify, 58 the program can only collect and retain records from providers who use the same software, 56,58 so Marion may find she still has to call around to obtain all the patient records she needs.

questionsJson.description: According to the man, why has a software program become popular?
answer: (A) It is less expensive than similar products.

questionsJson.description: What are the speakers discussing?
questionsJson.explanation:
W: Let's get this product-innovation meeting started. 59 Sales of our fruit-and-nut bars have been strong, so we'd like to develop some other types of snack bars. What do you recommend, Stan?

M: Well, we know that many people are allergic to nuts, so 60 we should develop some snack bars without nuts. The only thing is, we'd need a separate set of equipment to avoid contamination between the two production areas.

W: We don't have room at this facility for that. 61 Pedro, you've been to our new production facility ill Glenview, right? Is there space there for new equipment?

M: I think there's extra space there. 61 I’ll check with the facility manager to make sure, though.

questionsJson.description: What challenge does Stan mention?
answer: (C) There are not enough job applicants.

questionsJson.description: According to the man, why is today's Sea-Ride Special tour popular?
answer: (A) It offers a chance to see migrating birds.
(B) Water conditions are likely to be favorable.
(C) A guest chef is preparing lunch.
(D) Someone special will be guiding the tour.
questionsJson.explanation:
M: Welcome to The Boat Center. How may I help you?

W: Hi. 62 Do you have any tickets for the Sea - Ride Special tour today? I was hoping to catch a last-minute tour.

M: Sorry. 62 We're sold out. It's a really popular tour this time of year because the penguins are migrating through the area.

W: Oh, too bad. I'm leaving tomorrow morning, and I was really hoping to take one of your tours.

M: Well, 63 the Island Exploration tour still has a couple of spots left.

W: 63 Great! 64 And that'll give me time to get something to eat before it starts. I see there's a coffee shop just down the street.

questionsJson.description: Why does the woman apologize?
questionsJson.explanation:
M: Hi. I'm here for the health and well ness conference. I parked in the event center parking area. I was wondering, 65 is parking free for conference attendees?

W: 65 No. I'm sorry. We don't provide any reimbursements for parking. But 66 if you're willing to move your car, there's a cheaper parking area at Seventh Avenue and Vine Street. It's about a block away.

M: Oh, unfortunately, 67 I don't have time. I'm scheduled to attend the strength-training seminar that starts in fifteen minutes. But tomorrow I'll get here earlier and park at the other lot. Seventh and Vine, you said. Right?

W: That's correct.

questionsJson.description: Why does the woman call?
answer: (A) She wants to request a refund.
(B) She is unable to place an order online.
(C) She wants to extend a deadline.
(D) She is unhappy with a product purchased recently.
questionsJson.explanation:
M: Molina's Office Store. How can I help?

W: Hi. 68 I've been trying to order a product on your Web site, but every time I get to the checkout screen, everything freezes, and I can't place the order.

M: 69 What are you trying to buy?

W: 69 The Enzo 5000 scanner.

M: Hmm. That product's currently out of stock. Can I recommend the Rhenium 60 instead? It's a popular model.

W: I really need the Enzo 5000-l'm an artist and I make my own prints, so I need a model that produces top-quality images.

M: I see. Well, 70 we're expecting a shipment tomorrow. If it includes the model you're looking for, I can reserve it for you.
